\color{blue}

**Solution**.  

**(a)** 

$\mathbb{E}(X_1)=0 \times \frac{1}{3} + 1 \times \frac{2}{3} = \frac{2}{3}$

$\mathbb{E}(X_1^2)=0 \times \frac{1}{3} + 1^2 \times \frac{2}{3} = \frac{2}{3}$

$Var(X_1)=\mathbb{E}(X_1^2)-(\mathbb{E}(X_1))^2=\frac{2}{3} - (\frac{2}{3})^2 = \frac{2}{9}$
  
  
**(b)**  
$\mathbb{E}(\bar{X})=\mathbb{E}(\frac{\sum_{i=1}^n X_i}{n})=\frac{\sum_{i=1}^n X_i}{n} = \frac{n\mathbb{E}X_1}{n}=n\mathbb{E}X_1 =\frac{2}{3}$

$Var(\bar{X})=Var(\frac{\sum_{i=1}^n X_i}{n})= \frac{1}{n^2} Var(\sum_{i=1}^n X_i) = \frac{1}{n^2} \sum_{i=1}^n \text{Var}(X_i)= \frac{1}{n^2} n Var(X_1)=\frac{2}{9n}$

So, $\bar{X}\sim\mathcal{N}(\frac{2}{3},\frac{2}{9n})$
  
  
**(c) **  
Since $n=50$, so $\bar{X}\sim\mathcal{N}(\frac{2}{3},\frac{2}{450})$  
Hence, $\prob(0.45<\bar X<0.55) = \prob(\bar X<0.55) - \prob(\bar X<0.45) = pnorm(0.55,2/3,2/450) - pnorm(0.45,2/3,2/450)$

\color{black}
